title: How will history remember the American empire? - Quora

response.answer_text: ::How will history remember the American empire?:: The American Empire, or rather, the American World Hegemony, probably will be remembered just as its predecessor, the British Empire, is remembered today: as a vehicle for the political agenda of whoever is expressing an opinion about it. An Empire that trumpeted the values of individualism and unfettered private enterprise over the oppressive power of the State, but in reality was a corporatocratic Empire ‘built from the bones of the dead, with mud and straw, blood and sweat,’ with its own tropical Gulag in Guantánamo, in the name of those very same hypocritical values. A liberal Colossus that fought for Freedom & Democracy in WWII, and fought for decades against another Empire, an evil one, for Liberty and Democracy, and after vanquishing the Evil Empire, fought to maintain global order and promote worldwide prosperity. That’s the problem with empires: they are so complex and provoke such emotive responses, that to reach a consensus is impossible.

As the “Empire of Hypocrisy” for it’s always claimed to interfere and intervene in many other countries’ business, in the name of freedom, by killing legally elected rulers (president Allende of Chile in Cuba), robbing weaker countries off their rich natural resources (Banana Wars; occupation of the Philippines, semi-occupation of Cuba), financing gangs of terrorists full of psychopatic killers and self-proclaimed as “guerrillas” and “freedom fighters” (Nicaraguan Contras and Afghan Talibans); controling the ruling elite of a country and have presidents and officials elected to sell their countries’ resources for peanuts (Mexican political parties, PRI and PAN) and millions of deaths, both U.S. (U.S. soldiers sent to fight wars, risking life and limb only to make fat cats in the comfort of their mansions wealthier) and non U.S. on behalf of corporations insatiable of money. I suggest reading ‘War is a Racket,’ by USMC Major General Smedley Butler: Full text of "War Is A Racket"
